section.para: This section describes various conventions and practices used throughout all Red Hat Training courses.

section.title: Admonitions
section.para: Red Hat Training courses use the following admonitions:

note.para: These describe where to find external documentation relevant to a subject.
These are tips, shortcuts, or alternative approaches to the task at hand. Ignoring a note should have no negative consequences, but you might miss out on something that makes your life easier.

important.para: These provide details of information that is easily missed: configuration changes that only apply to the current session, or services that need restarting before an update will apply. Ignoring these admonitions will not cause data loss, but may cause irritation and frustration.

warning.para: These should not be ignored. Ignoring these admonitions will most likely cause data loss.

section.title: Inclusive Language
section.para: Red Hat Training is currently reviewing its use of language in various areas to help remove any potentially offensive terms. This is an ongoing process and requires alignment with the products and services covered in Red Hat Training courses. Red Hat appreciates your patience during this process.
